newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Bridgestone await offers, Singapore rubber thin.
newsitem.headline: Bridgestone await offers, Singapore rubber thin.

text.p: Bridgestone is said to be waiting for more offers in the market while Singapore rubber futures drifted on Tuesday in thin dealings, traders said.
"We heard Bridgestone is waiting for some more offers for SIR20 rubber. I think they bought a modest amount yesterday for forward delivery," a dealer said.
Traders said Bridgestone probably bought the rubber at a price between 50-51 U.S. cents a kg.
"Bridgestone wants to look at some more offers this afternoon and are waiting for them to come in," another dealer said.
Another market player was also bidding for SMR20 rubber for around 278-280 Malaysian cents a kg, but most sellers were seen a few cents higher, traders said.
"I think that group wants to sell a few hundred tonnes of SMR20 to China," a dealer said.

At around 0945 GMT, May RSS3 was seen at 118.00-120.00 U.S. cents a kg from the previous 120.00 cents. May RSS1 was seen at 172.00-174.00 Singapore cents (US$1.19-$1.21) a kg from 173.50 cents. June TSR20 was seen unchanged at 161.75 Singapore cents (US$1.12) a kg.
